header.title: Demon Stones: A Complete System of Demonolatry Divination

central_thesis: This book presents a complete and practical system of demonolatry divination using sixteen handcrafted 'Demon Stones,' each inscribed with a sigil of a specific demonic entity from the Dukante hierarchy. The system provides detailed instructions for creating, consecrating, empowering, and interpreting these stones to gain insight into various aspects of life, with distinct meanings for upright and reversed positions.

structure_content.summary: The author introduces the concept of Demon Stones as a novel divination method for Demonolators, explaining her motivation to create a system that details each Demon's elemental affinity and divinatory meanings, favoring the Dukante hierarchy for its practicality over the more extensive Goetia.

This chapter justifies the selection of the Dukante hierarchy due to its ease in assigning meanings for the sixteen chosen Demons, while acknowledging the Goetic hierarchy as an alternative, cautioning practitioners to conduct thorough research if opting for it.

Detailed instructions are provided for making the sixteen Demon Stones, including selecting natural rocks or quartz, drawing the specific sigils with permanent ink or paint, and adding a directional dot to indicate upright or reversed orientation for interpretation. Storage in a velveteen bag is recommended.

A comprehensive ritual is outlined to consecrate and empower the crafted Demon Stones, designed to imbue them with Demonic energy for divination. This involves specific ritual tools, prepared oleums (anointing oils), enns (invocations), a Demonic circle, and personal life force, followed by elemental purification stages.

structure_content.chapter_title: V. The Sixteen Demon Stones: Attributes
structure_content.summary: This extensive section provides the elemental correspondence and detailed divinatory attributes for each of the sixteen Demon Stones (Belial, Lucifer, Flereous/Flauros, Leviathan, Verrine, Amducious, Unsere, Eurynomous, Belphegore, Rosier, Delepitore, Tezrian, Ashtaroth, Lucifuge Rofocale/Focalor, Ronwe/Ronove, Satan). Each Demon's meaning is categorized across money, love, mental, physical, and spiritual aspects, with distinct interpretations for upright (positive) and reversed (negative/hidden) positions.

Five different layouts for using the Demon Stones are presented: the Four Stone Reading (mental, physical, spiritual, path), the Six Stone Reading (past, present, future), the Astrological Reading (a detailed 12-house spread with astrological meanings), the Single Stone Reading (quick insight), and the Diamond Reading (hidden conflict, foundation, forces, conclusion).

A practical example demonstrating the application of the Six Stone Reading spread is provided, illustrating how to interpret the drawn stones in context to a specific question, including the interplay between upright and reversed meanings for each position.

key_concepts.definition: A set of sixteen individually crafted stones, each bearing a unique sigil of a specific Demon, used as a system for Demonolatry divination. These are physical objects imbued with magical purpose.

The primary system of demonic classification utilized by the author, favored for its practical application in assigning distinct, manageable divinatory meanings to each of the sixteen chosen Demons. This contrasts with more extensive hierarchies like the Goetia.

The unique esoteric symbols representing each Demon. These are drawn onto the Demon Stones and are central to their identity and magical efficacy. A dot added to the top of the sigil indicates the 'upright' orientation for reading.

A critical interpretative mechanic where the orientation of the drawn stone (indicated by the dot on the sigil) determines whether the positive/active attributes (upright) or the negative/hidden aspects (reversed) of the Demon's meaning are applied to the divination.

A multi-stage magical operation designed to activate and charge the Demon Stones. It involves preparing ritual tools, using specific oleums and enns for invocation, a Demonic circle, personal life force transfer, and purification through elemental representations (dirt, water, fire, incense).

Specially formulated anointing oils, with specific herbal and aromatic recipes provided (e.g., Delepitore: Mugwort, Hibiscus, Ground Ivy, Yarrow), used during the consecration ritual to enhance the energetic connection to the respective Demonic entity.

Short, vibratory phrases or invocations (e.g., Delepitore's enn: 'Deyen pretore ramec Delepitore on ca.') used to call upon and establish a connection with specific Demons during the ritual and potentially in practice.

The specific meanings assigned to each Demon Stone, detailed across various categories like Money, Love, Mental, Physical, and Spiritual. These attributes provide the framework for interpreting the stones' messages in a reading, adjusted by their upright or reversed status.

practical_system.description: The practical system detailed in 'Demon Stones' is a form of geomancy or lithomancy, specifically 'Demon Stone Divination'. Practitioners create a set of sixteen physical stones, each inscribed with a unique Demonic sigil. These stones undergo a rigorous consecration and empowerment ritual, imbuing them with the essence and power of the corresponding Demons. Once consecrated, the stones are used in various layouts or 'spreads' to answer questions or gain insight. The interpretation of each stone depends on its assigned Demonic attributes and its orientation (upright or reversed, indicated by a dot on the sigil). The system emphasizes a direct, personal connection with the invoked Demons as sources of divinatory knowledge.
tools: Permanent ink or paint for sigils
Usual ritual tools (dagger, candles, incense burner, offering/burning bowl, bowl of sea salt, bowl of water)
Oleum of Delepitore, Azlyn, or Vassago (recipes provided)
Lancet or other sharp implement (for blood offering in dirt/water)
Extra bowl of salted water (prepared with blood)
One red candle in a holder
rituals: Crafting the Demon Stones (selecting natural stones, drawing sigils, adding orientation dot)

Consecration and Empowerment Ritual (altar arrangement, casting Demonic circle, invoking chosen Demon/Satan, passing stones through incense, consecrating with specific enn, empowering with life force through candle flame, resting stones in dirt for one day)
Oleum Rite (anointing each stone with specific oleums in a Demonic circle, allowing to dry, then storing in a velveteen bag)
Yearly Cleansing and Blessing of stones

relevant_quotes.text: I have always wanted to invent a special form of divination for Demonolators.
The hierarchy that I use for this form of divination is the Dukante hierarchy because it was easier to pick and choose from this list than using the Goetia, which includes 72 demons.
Demon stones are a set of sixteen stones that you make yourself.
Place a dot at the top of the sigil. This will help determine whether the stone you are reading is a positive or negative force.

This ritual is designed to consecrate and empower your Demon Stones. It is a process in itself and should be utilized to make your stones as powerful as possible. This ritual is done after the stones have been made.

Note: When reading the Demon Stones, the positive attribute is read when the stone is facing right side up. When the stone is reversed (dot side down), the negative or hidden aspects of the stone is read.

critical_analysis.relevance: This book offers a modern, practical, and highly personalized approach to divination within Demonolatry, a niche but growing area of occultism. It directly addresses the need for tailored magical tools and systems that resonate with practitioners of specific infernal traditions, moving beyond generic divination methods. Its focus on the Dukante hierarchy provides a distinct framework, offering an alternative to the more commonly explored Goetic system. The detailed instructions for creation and consecration make it a hands-on grimoire for the individual practitioner, emphasizing direct engagement with the chosen entities. It serves as a valuable resource for those seeking to deepen their operative work with specific Demons for guidance and insight.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The target audience consists primarily of practitioners of Demonolatry and other forms of modern occultism who have an established practice or are committed to exploring infernal magic. It is suitable for those familiar with basic ritual work (e.g., casting a magical circle, invoking entities) and who desire to create personal, consecrated divination tools. Individuals interested in personalized magical systems, sigil magic, and the specific hierarchies like Dukante or Goetia will find this book particularly relevant. It caters to magicians seeking not just theoretical knowledge but practical, operative instructions for a tangible divination system.
